inventory.commentary: Note: If the instance is not one of the following verb particle constructions or multi-word expressions, please mark the instance as None of the Above. Note: ONLY choose from these senses for the specific phrases listed below. Please check carefully. Extra modifiers may be added, but be sure that the gloss in each sense still covers the usage. Note: If the instance is a light verb, it belongs in sense 1 of take-v.xml, so choose "None of Above."

sense.name: take a break or vacation
sense.commentary: Includes: TAKE A BREAK, TAKE A BREATHER, TAKE FIVE, TAKE LEAVE, TAKE OFF, TAKE TEN, TAKE TIME OFF
sense.examples: They can either take a break or try a different approach to the problem. The musicians took five during the rehearsal. It sounds like you need to take some time off to relax. We decided to take a breather until it was time to go. They took off a few days to rest up. You can take leave for 4-5 days while you recuperate. Once a month, they take a junket to Hawaii or Europe. Should I take a year out and then return?

sense.name: trick, deceive
sense.commentary: Includes: TAKE IN, TAKE FOR A RIDE
sense.examples: The immigrant was taken in because he trusted everyone. Try not to be taken for a ride by scammers.

sense.name: challenge, contend
sense.commentary: Includes: TAKE ON Note: This sense does not include "claim or conquer, become in control of" as in sense 8 of take-v.xml. If this occurs in this vpc task, please choose "None of the Above."
sense.examples: I'll take on this difficult task. Charlie likes to take Mary on in soccer.

sense.name: project anger on someone
sense.examples: Don't take it out on your spouse.

sense.name: kill; degrade or defeat
sense.commentary: Includes: TAKE A LIFE, TAKE OUT, TAKE DOWN
sense.examples: In the Wild West, you'll need to take out the criminals using only your trusty pistol. The storm took the sailors' lives. His critics took him down after the lecture.

sense.name: happen
sense.examples: While the conversation took place, it rapidly grew dark. The event is set to take stage on Saturday.

sense.name: become dominant; assume control
sense.commentary: Includes: TAKE CHARGE, TAKE CONTROL TAKE HOLD OF, TAKE OVER
sense.examples: Mrs. Ward took over in 1986. The program helped many clients take hold of their finances. Investors are trying to take control of the company immediately. Take charge of the situation before it's too late!

sense.name: speak, give a speech
sense.commentary: Includes: TAKE THE FLOOR, TAKE THE STAND
sense.examples: Our opponents took the stand to describe "awkward" situations. Whenever I took the floor to speak, I could see that they were not really listening.

sense.name: be resolute or firm
sense.commentary: Includes: TAKE A FIRM STAND, TAKE A HARD LINE
sense.examples: The manager takes a hard line with people who show up late. The officials have finally decided to take a firm stand on this rule.

sense.name: suffer or fail (as a consequence)
sense.commentary: Includes: TAKE IT, TAKE IT ON THE CHIN, TAKE ONE FOR THE TEAM, TAKE ONE'S LUMPS, TAKE THE BLAME, TAKE LYING DOWN
sense.examples: The organization took it on the chin this week. She took lumps for her opinion, but it's hard to argue with her premise. She isn't going to take it lying down. He made many mistakes, but failed to take the blame for any of them.

sense.name: excrete
sense.commentary: Includes: TAKE A CRAP, TAKE A LEAK, TAKE A PISS, TAKE A SHIT
sense.examples: He left for a minute to take a leak. The dog had taken a crap in the flower beds.

sense.name: (cause to) feel better, hope
sense.examples: She took heart in his words. You can take comfort in such a promise.

sense.name: Other MWEs
sense.commentary: Note: ONLY choose this sense for the phrases listed below. Otherwise, please mark the instance as None of the Above. Note: DO NOT choose this sense for "take a joke" or "take lying down." These instances fit in sense 12 of take-v.xml. Choose "None of the Above" if they occur in this vpc task. Note: DO NOT choose this sense for "take drunk" or "take ill." These instances belong in sense 13 of take-v.xml. Choose "None of the Above" if they occur in this task.
sense.examples: TAKE A CHILL TAKE A HIT TAKE A POWDER TAKE ABACK TAKE ADVANTAGE TAKE AFTER TAKE BACK TAKE CARE TAKE DOWN TAKE FOR GRANTED TAKE HOME TAKE IN VAIN TAKE IN CHARGE TAKE ISSUE TAKE IT EASY TAKE ITS/HIS/HER TOLL TAKE KINDLY TO TAKE OFF TAKE OUT TAKE PAINS TAKE PART TAKE STOCK TAKE THE AIR TAKE THE BULL BY THE HORNS TAKE THE CAKE TAKE THE COUNT TAKE THE FIELD TAKE THE FIFTH TAKE THE FIFTH AMENDMENT TAKE THE FLOOR TAKE THE ROAD TAKE THE VEIL TAKE TIME BY THE FORELOCK TAKE TO HEART TAKE TO TASK TAKE TO THE HILLS/AIR/AIRWAVES/COURTS TAKE TURNS TAKE UP ARMS TAKE WATER
